info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 27 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Cabarrus County through 600 PM EDT... At 529 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles northeast of Downtown Concord, or 4 miles northwest of Mt Pleasant, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Downtown Concord, Kannapolis, Mt Pleasant and West Concord. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
